result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Refrain from conduct which constitutes a violation of the criminal laws of any state of the United States or ordinances substantially conforming to a criminal statute.
Remain subject to terms and conditions of bond.
AODA assessment and compliance.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Desiree L. Harms

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:45 a.m. Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Desiree Harms not in court. Schiek statements to court - she has been in compliance, asks court to dismiss action. No objection from Bennett. Court grants. 11:46 a.m.
from Michelle at Attorney Bennett's office requesting Attorney Bennett be removed as counsel-stated he was not appointed on rescinding DEJ

ADDRESS INFO for Desiree L. Harms
Current: 10 S 2nd St #5, Tomahawk, WI 54487 United States  (Effective: 03-10-2017)
Prior: 116 S 2nd St, Tomahawk, WI 54487 United States

1:32 p.m. Defendant Desiree L. Harms in court via video with attorney Mary Burns.   Defendant Desiree L. Harms in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thomas Wiensch appears for State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm493 11pa24pj, 13fa161.  Burns states that defendant qualifies for PD but one needs to be appointed. Wiensch statement to bond. Schiek statement to bond. Court sets bond - $5,000 signature bond in family cases; $2,500 signature bond in criminal cases. All cases scheduled for April 6, 2017 at 11:00 a.m. in Branch 2. Adj. 1:37 p.m.
per Amy @ ONSO - in custody - ONSO
per Jack @ ONSO - detainer - Lincol County

3:57 p.m. Defendant Desiree L. Harms not in court.  Mchael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek believes notice was properly given to defendant - based upon failure to appear Schiek requests agreement be rescinded and requests warrant to be issued. Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 3:59 p.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Desiree L. Harms
Current: 116 S 2nd St, Tomahawk, WI 54487 United States  (Effective: 03-22-2016)
Prior: W5816 Theisen Road, Tomahawk, WI 54487

3:24 p.m. Defendant Desiree L. Harms in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss but read in Count 2 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. DEJ filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists, defers entry of judgment and accepts Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement. Bail continued. Adj. 3:31 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for February 13, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

3:26 pm. Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bennett states that defendant is in Lincoln County jail on probation hold   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued. Adj. 3:28 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

2:12 p.m. Defendant Desiree L. Harms in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint to be provided, right to counsel - Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
